QAPair.Question: What is (are) Parkinson disease - discharge ?
QAPair.Answer: Your health care provider has told you that you have Parkinson disease . This disease affects your brain and leads to tremors, problems with walking, movement, and coordination. Other symptoms or problems that may appear later on include difficulty swallowing, constipation, and drooling.

Question.qtype: when to contact a medical professional

QAPair.Question: Do I need to see a doctor for Parkinson disease - discharge ?
